_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The ten grounds to suspend the recitatio: A mendicant who has committed an expulsion offense is sitting in the assembly.
A discussion about whether someone has committed an expulsion offense is unfinished.
A person who is not fully ordained is sitting in the assembly.
A discussion about whether someone is fully ordained or not is unfinished.
Someone who has resigned the training is sitting in the assembly.
A discussion about whether someone has rejected the training or not is unfinished.
A eunuch is sitting in the assembly.
A discussion about whether someone is a eunuch is unfinished.
A raper of nuns is sitting in the assembly.
A discussion about whether or not someone is a raper of nuns is unfinished.
